newsitem.title: GERMANY: Oil World sees oilmeal output below expectations.
newsitem.headline: Oil World sees oilmeal output below expectations.

text.p: World production of oilseed meals in the 1996/97 (October/September) season, at 166.81 million tonnes, should be above the 166.07 million tonnes seen in 1995/96 but below earlier expectations, the Oil World newsletter said.
The independent publication cited smaller carry-in stocks of oilseed and cuts in production forecasts for cottonseed and rapeseed.
But Asian net meal import demand was set to rise sharply to 5.4 million tonnes in 1996/97 after 4.4 million in 1995/96.
Oil World, which based this forecast on 10 Far Eastern countries, including China, cited an expansion in livestock industries in the region.
China alone should import 2.5 million tonnes of soymeal in 1996/97 after an estimated 1.6 million in the 1995/96 season.
U.S. soymeal demand was seen stagnant at 24.25 million tonnes in 1996/97.
But oilmeal consumption in the EU-15 would fall to 44.75 million tonnes after 45.76 million in 1995/96 because of favourable feed grain prices amid high crops and stocks.
EU soymeal consumption was pegged at 21.65 million tonnes in 1996/97 (22.40 million in 1995/96).
